title: Shifting

en: A client you've been working with emails you; they need the job done a full week sooner than originally anticipated! Yikes! You'd have to pull an all-nighter to get it done, and even then you're not sure you can pull it off.

yes_caption: Put your nose to the grindstone, and burn the candle at both ends.
no_caption: Apologize, but insist on the original deadline on principle of not being railroaded into stress.

en: You work with intense focus (and several cups of coffee) to finish the job overnight. It's not perfect, but the client is ecstatic and sends you a nice bonus for the work.
The client understands but sounds disappointed. You do eventually finish the job, but you get the feeling you won't be receiving work from them in the future.
